Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; rim not offset on inside, but sharply bevelled on outside; interior: wide reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with broad band between; glazed below.
Curator's comments: The profile of the cup is unusual. The rim finds parallels with Schlotzhauer's (Schlotzhauer 2012) Type 10 South Ionian cups but the body does not. Furthermore, the junction of the rim and body are bevelled and this is not typical of the shape. Finally, the angle of the bowl finds its closest parallels in Hayes' Ionian Cup Type IV (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), a type which is not (otherwise) observed at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.254) (Phase 3)
